title: Health Emergency
description: Guidelines to follow during medical or health-related emergencies.

sections.subtitle: Call for Help
sections.description: Dial your local emergency hotline (e.g., 911 in the Philippines) or contact the nearest hospital immediately.

sections.subtitle: Provide Basic First Aid
sections.description: If trained, perform CPR for unconscious individuals or apply basic wound care until professionals arrive.

sections.subtitle: Stay Calm and Reassure
sections.description: Keep the patient calm and comfortable while waiting for emergency responders.

title: Police / Safety Emergency
description: Steps to take when faced with crimes, safety threats, or suspicious activities.

sections.subtitle: Contact Police Immediately
sections.description: Dial 911 or your local police station. Provide clear details about the situation and location.

sections.subtitle: Stay Safe
sections.description: Avoid confrontation. Move to a secure area if possible while waiting for authorities.

sections.subtitle: Provide Accurate Information
sections.description: When reporting, remain calm and give specific details such as descriptions of people, vehicles, or events.

title: Fire Emergency
description: Safety measures to follow during fire incidents.

sections.subtitle: Evacuate Immediately
sections.description: Do not attempt to save belongings. Leave the building quickly and safely.

sections.subtitle: Call the Fire Department
sections.description: Dial 911 or your local fire hotline. Provide exact location and nature of the fire.

sections.subtitle: Stay Low and Cover Nose
sections.description: If there is smoke, stay close to the ground and cover your nose and mouth with cloth.

sections.subtitle: Do Not Use Elevators
sections.description: Always use stairs when evacuating during a fire emergency.
